modules.title: Browser Segmentation
modules.description: Why you should separate real-life and degen activity across different browsers or profiles. Use Brave for trading, Chrome for personal accounts, etc.

lessons.title: Why Browser Segmentation Matters
lessons.content:
**The Problem with Single Browser Usage:**

**Security Risks:**
â€¢ **Cross-Contamination**: Malicious sites can access data from other tabs
â€¢ **Session Hijacking**: One compromised session affects everything
â€¢ **Extension Vulnerabilities**: Risky extensions can access all your data
â€¢ **Tracking**: Sites can track you across different activities
â€¢ **Data Leakage**: Personal info mixed with trading activities

**Real-World Scenarios:**
â€¢ **Drainer Attack**: Malicious site drains your wallet
â€¢ **Phishing Site**: Fake site steals your credentials
â€¢ **Malicious Extension**: Extension steals your data
â€¢ **Session Theft**: Someone gains access to your accounts
â€¢ **Cross-Site Scripting**: Malicious code runs in your browser

**Benefits of Browser Segmentation:**
â€¢ **Isolation**: Problems in one browser don't affect others
â€¢ **Privacy**: Keep personal and trading activities separate
â€¢ **Security**: Reduce attack surface
â€¢ **Organization**: Easier to manage different activities
â€¢ **Recovery**: If one browser is compromised, others are safe

**Recommended Browser Setup:**
â€¢ **Brave**: For Web3 trading and DeFi activities
â€¢ **Chrome**: For personal accounts and regular browsing
â€¢ **Firefox**: For sensitive activities (banking, etc.)
â€¢ **Edge**: For work-related activities
â€¢ **Safari**: For Apple ecosystem activities

**Pro Tips:**
â€¢ Use different email addresses for each browser
â€¢ Don't sync bookmarks between browsers
â€¢ Use different passwords for each browser
â€¢ Clear cookies regularly
â€¢ Use incognito/private mode for sensitive activities

lessons.title: Setting Up Browser Profiles
lessons.content:
**How to Create Browser Profiles:**

**Chrome Profile Setup:**
â€¢ **Step 1**: Open Chrome and click your profile icon
â€¢ **Step 2**: Click "Add" to create a new profile
â€¢ **Step 3**: Name it (e.g., "Trading", "Personal", "Work")
â€¢ **Step 4**: Choose a color and icon
â€¢ **Step 5**: Sign in with different Google accounts

**Firefox Profile Setup:**
â€¢ **Step 1**: Type `about:profiles` in address bar
â€¢ **Step 2**: Click "Create a New Profile"
â€¢ **Step 3**: Name your profile
â€¢ **Step 4**: Choose profile location
â€¢ **Step 5**: Set as default if desired

**Brave Profile Setup:**
â€¢ **Step 1**: Click the profile icon in top right
â€¢ **Step 2**: Click "Add New Profile"
â€¢ **Step 3**: Name your profile
â€¢ **Step 4**: Choose sync settings
â€¢ **Step 5**: Customize settings for each profile

**Profile Organization Strategy:**

**Trading Profile:**
â€¢ **Browser**: Brave or Chrome
â€¢ **Extensions**: Wallet extensions, trading tools
â€¢ **Bookmarks**: Trading sites, DEXs, charts
â€¢ **Settings**: Enhanced privacy, ad blocking
â€¢ **Accounts**: Trading-specific accounts only

**Personal Profile:**
â€¢ **Browser**: Chrome or Firefox
â€¢ **Extensions**: Minimal, trusted only
â€¢ **Bookmarks**: Personal sites, social media
â€¢ **Settings**: Standard privacy settings
â€¢ **Accounts**: Personal accounts only

**Work Profile:**
â€¢ **Browser**: Edge or Chrome
â€¢ **Extensions**: Work-related tools only
â€¢ **Bookmarks**: Work sites, productivity tools
â€¢ **Settings**: Company security policies
â€¢ **Accounts**: Work accounts only

**Pro Tips:**
â€¢ Use different passwords for each profile
â€¢ Don't share bookmarks between profiles
â€¢ Clear data regularly
â€¢ Use different email addresses
â€¢ Keep trading profile isolated

modules.title: Trusted vs Risky Extensions
modules.description: Learn which browser extensions are safe (wallets, blockers) and which are data mines or security risks.

lessons.title: Safe Browser Extensions
lessons.content:
**Trusted Extension Categories:**

**Wallet Extensions:**
â€¢ **MetaMask**: Most trusted Ethereum wallet
â€¢ **Phantom**: Popular Solana wallet
â€¢ **Brave Wallet**: Built into Brave browser
â€¢ **Coinbase Wallet**: Official Coinbase extension
â€¢ **Trust Wallet**: Binance's wallet extension

**Privacy & Security:**
â€¢ **uBlock Origin**: Ad and tracker blocker
â€¢ **Privacy Badger**: Automatic tracker blocking
â€¢ **HTTPS Everywhere**: Forces secure connections
â€¢ **NoScript**: Blocks JavaScript execution
â€¢ **Cookie AutoDelete**: Automatically deletes cookies

**Trading Tools:**
â€¢ **TradingView**: Chart analysis tools
â€¢ **CoinGecko**: Price tracking
â€¢ **DeBank**: DeFi portfolio tracker
â€¢ **DEXScreener**: DEX data and charts
â€¢ **Coinhall**: Solana trading data

**Productivity:**
â€¢ **LastPass**: Password manager
â€¢ **1Password**: Secure password management
â€¢ **Bitwarden**: Open-source password manager
â€¢ **Grammarly**: Writing assistant
â€¢ **Notion Web Clipper**: Save web content

**How to Verify Extensions:**
â€¢ **Check Reviews**: Look for high ratings and many reviews
â€¢ **Developer Info**: Research the developer/company
â€¢ **Permissions**: Review what permissions it requests
â€¢ **Update Frequency**: Regular updates are good
â€¢ **Open Source**: Open source extensions are often safer

**Red Flags to Watch For:**
â€¢ **Too Many Permissions**: Requests unnecessary access
â€¢ **No Reviews**: New or unpopular extensions
â€¢ **Suspicious Developer**: Unknown or sketchy developer
â€¢ **Aggressive Marketing**: Spammy or pushy advertising
â€¢ **Copycat Names**: Imitates popular extensions

lessons.title: Dangerous Extensions to Avoid
lessons.content:
**Risky Extension Categories:**

**Data Mining Extensions:**
â€¢ **Free VPNs**: Often sell your data
â€¢ **Productivity Tools**: May track your browsing
â€¢ **Shopping Extensions**: Track your purchases
â€¢ **Social Media Tools**: Access your social accounts
â€¢ **Gaming Extensions**: May contain malware

**Malicious Extensions:**
â€¢ **Fake Wallets**: Imitate real wallet extensions
â€¢ **Phishing Tools**: Designed to steal credentials
â€¢ **Cryptocurrency Miners**: Use your computer for mining
â€¢ **Ad Injectors**: Insert unwanted ads
â€¢ **Browser Hijackers**: Change your homepage/search

**Common Attack Vectors:**
â€¢ **Fake MetaMask**: Malicious copy of MetaMask
â€¢ **Fake Phantom**: Malicious copy of Phantom
â€¢ **Fake Trading Tools**: Imitate legitimate trading tools
â€¢ **Fake Password Managers**: Steal your passwords
â€¢ **Fake Ad Blockers**: Actually show more ads

**How to Spot Fake Extensions:**
â€¢ **Check URL**: Verify it's from official store
â€¢ **Developer Name**: Should match official company
â€¢ **Install Count**: Popular extensions have many installs
â€¢ **Reviews**: Look for authentic reviews
â€¢ **Permissions**: Should be minimal and relevant

**Protection Strategies:**
â€¢ **Only Install from Official Stores**: Chrome Web Store, Firefox Add-ons
â€¢ **Verify Developer**: Research the developer/company
â€¢ **Read Permissions**: Understand what it can access
â€¢ **Start Small**: Install one extension at a time
â€¢ **Monitor Behavior**: Watch for unusual activity

**Pro Tips:**
â€¢ **Whitelist Approach**: Only install essential extensions
â€¢ **Regular Audits**: Review installed extensions monthly
â€¢ **Remove Unused**: Delete extensions you don't use
â€¢ **Update Regularly**: Keep extensions updated
â€¢ **Backup Settings**: Export extension settings

modules.title: Permission Control
modules.description: How to manually lock down your browser permissions: clipboard, popups, autofill, microphone, and more.

lessons.title: Understanding Browser Permissions
lessons.content:
**What are Browser Permissions?**
Browser permissions control what websites and extensions can access on your device.

**Common Permissions:**

**Location:**
â€¢ **What it does**: Allows sites to know your location
â€¢ **Risk**: Privacy invasion, tracking
â€¢ **Recommendation**: Block for most sites
â€¢ **When to allow**: Only for mapping/navigation sites

**Camera:**
â€¢ **What it does**: Access to your webcam
â€¢ **Risk**: Unauthorized video recording
â€¢ **Recommendation**: Block by default
â€¢ **When to allow**: Only for video calls

**Microphone:**
â€¢ **What it does**: Access to your microphone
â€¢ **Risk**: Audio recording without consent
â€¢ **Recommendation**: Block by default
â€¢ **When to allow**: Only for voice calls

**Notifications:**
â€¢ **What it does**: Send push notifications
â€¢ **Risk**: Spam, unwanted alerts
â€¢ **Recommendation**: Block for most sites
â€¢ **When to allow**: Only for important services

**Clipboard:**
â€¢ **What it does**: Read/write to clipboard
â€¢ **Risk**: Steal copied data
â€¢ **Recommendation**: Block by default
â€¢ **When to allow**: Only for trusted tools

**Autofill:**
â€¢ **What it does**: Auto-fill forms with saved data
â€¢ **Risk**: Data theft, form manipulation
â€¢ **Recommendation**: Disable for sensitive sites
â€¢ **When to allow**: Only for trusted sites

**Popups:**
â€¢ **What it does**: Open new windows/tabs
â€¢ **Risk**: Malicious popups, scams
â€¢ **Recommendation**: Block by default
â€¢ **When to allow**: Only for trusted sites

**JavaScript:**
â€¢ **What it does**: Run code on websites
â€¢ **Risk**: Malicious scripts, tracking
â€¢ **Recommendation**: Allow but use blockers
â€¢ **When to block**: Suspicious sites only

lessons.title: Locking Down Your Browser
lessons.content:
**How to Secure Browser Permissions:**

**Chrome Security Settings:**
â€¢ **Step 1**: Go to Settings > Privacy and Security
â€¢ **Step 2**: Click "Site Settings"
â€¢ **Step 3**: Configure each permission:
  - **Location**: Block
  - **Camera**: Block
  - **Microphone**: Block
  - **Notifications**: Block
  - **Popups**: Block
  - **JavaScript**: Allow (use extensions to block)

**Firefox Security Settings:**
â€¢ **Step 1**: Go to Settings > Privacy & Security
â€¢ **Step 2**: Set "Enhanced Tracking Protection" to Strict
â€¢ **Step 3**: Configure permissions:
  - **Location**: Block
  - **Camera**: Block
  - **Microphone**: Block
  - **Notifications**: Block
  - **Popups**: Block

**Brave Security Settings:**
â€¢ **Step 1**: Go to Settings > Shields
â€¢ **Step 2**: Set Shields to "Aggressive"
â€¢ **Step 3**: Configure site settings:
  - **Location**: Block
  - **Camera**: Block
  - **Microphone**: Block
  - **Notifications**: Block
  - **Popups**: Block

**Advanced Security Measures:**

**Content Security Policy:**
â€¢ **What it does**: Controls what resources can load
â€¢ **Implementation**: Use browser extensions
â€¢ **Benefits**: Prevents XSS attacks
â€¢ **Configuration**: Block inline scripts

**HTTP Strict Transport Security:**
â€¢ **What it does**: Forces HTTPS connections
â€¢ **Implementation**: Built into modern browsers
â€¢ **Benefits**: Prevents man-in-the-middle attacks
â€¢ **Configuration**: Enable in browser settings

**Pro Tips:**
â€¢ **Whitelist Approach**: Block everything, allow only what you need
â€¢ **Regular Audits**: Check permissions monthly
â€¢ **Use Extensions**: Security extensions can help
â€¢ **Test Settings**: Make sure sites still work
â€¢ **Backup Settings**: Export your security configuration

modules.title: Hardening for Web3
modules.description: How to prepare your browser before interacting with mints, airdrops, or DApps. Avoid drainers before they drain you.

lessons.title: Web3 Security Threats
lessons.content:
**Common Web3 Security Threats:**

**Drainer Attacks:**
â€¢ **What it is**: Malicious sites that drain your wallet
â€¢ **How it works**: Tricks you into signing malicious transactions
â€¢ **Signs**: Unrealistic promises, urgent pressure
â€¢ **Protection**: Never sign transactions from unknown sites
â€¢ **Recovery**: Use hardware wallets, separate hot wallets

**Phishing Sites:**
â€¢ **What it is**: Fake sites that look like real ones
â€¢ **How it works**: Steals your private keys or seed phrases
â€¢ **Signs**: Slightly different URLs, poor design
â€¢ **Protection**: Always verify URLs, use bookmarks
â€¢ **Recovery**: Never enter seed phrases on websites

**Malicious DApps:**
â€¢ **What it is**: Decentralized apps with hidden malicious code
â€¢ **How it works**: Executes unwanted transactions
â€¢ **Signs**: Unrealistic returns, pressure to act fast
â€¢ **Protection**: Research DApps before using
â€¢ **Recovery**: Use separate wallets for testing

**Fake Airdrops:**
â€¢ **What it is**: Fake token distributions
â€¢ **How it works**: Claims to give free tokens but steals your data
â€¢ **Signs**: Too good to be true, urgent deadlines
â€¢ **Protection**: Verify airdrops through official channels
â€¢ **Recovery**: Never connect wallets to unknown sites

**Malicious Extensions:**
â€¢ **What it is**: Browser extensions that steal crypto
â€¢ **How it works**: Intercepts wallet connections
â€¢ **Signs**: Fake wallet extensions, suspicious permissions
â€¢ **Protection**: Only install from official sources
â€¢ **Recovery**: Remove suspicious extensions immediately

**Prevention Strategies:**
â€¢ **Use Hardware Wallets**: Keep most funds offline
â€¢ **Separate Wallets**: Use different wallets for different purposes
â€¢ **Research Everything**: Verify before interacting
â€¢ **Slow Down**: Don't rush into opportunities
â€¢ **Stay Updated**: Keep software updated

lessons.title: Preparing Your Browser for Web3
lessons.content:
**Web3 Browser Setup Checklist:**

**Essential Extensions:**
â€¢ **MetaMask**: For Ethereum interactions
â€¢ **Phantom**: For Solana interactions
â€¢ **uBlock Origin**: Block malicious ads and trackers
â€¢ **Privacy Badger**: Additional privacy protection
â€¢ **NoScript**: Block malicious scripts

**Browser Settings:**
â€¢ **Disable JavaScript**: For unknown sites
â€¢ **Block Popups**: Prevent malicious popups
â€¢ **Disable Autofill**: Prevent data theft
â€¢ **Clear Cookies**: Regularly clear browsing data
â€¢ **Use Incognito**: For sensitive transactions

**Wallet Security:**
â€¢ **Hardware Wallet**: Use for large amounts
â€¢ **Hot Wallet**: Use for small amounts only
â€¢ **Separate Wallets**: Different wallets for different purposes
â€¢ **Backup Seeds**: Store securely offline
â€¢ **Test Transactions**: Small amounts first

**Site Verification:**
â€¢ **Check URLs**: Verify you're on the right site
â€¢ **Use Bookmarks**: Bookmark trusted sites
â€¢ **Research Projects**: Verify before investing
â€¢ **Check Social Media**: Official announcements only
â€¢ **Avoid FOMO**: Don't rush into opportunities

**Transaction Safety:**
â€¢ **Review Transactions**: Always check before signing
â€¢ **Gas Limits**: Set appropriate gas limits
â€¢ **Slippage**: Use reasonable slippage settings
â€¢ **Test Transactions**: Small amounts first
â€¢ **Monitor Activity**: Check wallet activity regularly

**Pro Tips:**
â€¢ **Start Small**: Test with small amounts
â€¢ **Stay Informed**: Follow security news
â€¢ **Use Multiple Browsers**: Separate activities
â€¢ **Regular Audits**: Check security monthly
â€¢ **Backup Everything**: Keep backups secure
